description: Just two days after being grilled by the Senate over its deadly Triple Zero outage, Optus is dealing with another technical issue - which impacted tens of thousands of customers in New South Wales. title: Death Toll Rises To Seven In Kentucky Plane Crash As Investigations Continue | 10 News
description: The search for survivors is continuing in Kentucky, after a fully loaded cargo plane crashed just seconds into take-off, killing seven people.  The UPS jet was already on fire as it hurtled down the runway, and then slammed into a petrol plant, sparking an enormous explosion. title: Cough Syrup Rikodeine Misused By Teens To Make Highly Addictive 'Purple Drank' | 10 News+
description: A rapper has revealed how easy it is to purchase a highly addictive, over-the-counter drug without a script at Australian pharmacies. Cough syrup Rikodeine is a derivative of codeine, and there are now concerns teens are purchasing it to mix with soft drink or alcohol to make what’s known as “purple drank” or “lean”. Rikodeine and alcohol both slow down your breathing rate, worrying medical practitioners that, when combined, it could cause brain damage or even death. title: Kentucky Plane Crash Death Toll Updated, Black Box Found | 10 News
description: The death toll of the fiery UPS cargo plane crash in Louisville, Kentucky has been updated to at least nine people.  While only three were onboard the flight which was departing to Honolulu, six others have been confirmed dead, with 11 more injured.  Authorities expect the number of fatalities to rise.  The National Transport Safety Board advise that the plane's left wing caught fire and its engine fell off, just before it crashed and exploded after taking off.  They have also confirmed the aircraft's cockpit voice recorder and the flight data recorder, commonly known as the black box, has been found. title: 'Lion' Sighting Ends With Hilarious Find | 10 News
description: Police in Ireland were befuddled when reports surfaced of a lion prowling around town, but all was not as it seemed.  The wild hunt was sparked by this video, which claimed to show the big cat on the loose, and officers were called in to investigate.  10’s Late News explains. title: Trump Attacks Zohran Mamdani’s Historic NYC Win As Democrats Sweep Major US Races | 10 News
description: US President Donald Trump has attacked Democratic socialist Zohran Mamdani’s landmark victory in New York City, calling it a loss of “sovereignty”.  Speaking at a Miami forum marking a year since his re-election, Trump praised his economic record, saying, “We have the greatest economy right now. A lot of people don’t see that,” but offered few new ideas, instead revisiting familiar themes of crime, immigration and opposition to transgender rights.  His remarks came after Democrats swept key races across the country, winning governorships in New Jersey and Virginia, the mayoralty in New York City, and a major California ballot initiative to redraw congressional districts in response to Republican-led efforts elsewhere.  While Trump warned Mamdani’s win showed the rise of “radical policies,” observers say it signals a deepening appetite for progressive change, with voters embracing Mamdani’s platform of wealth redistribution, free childcare and expanded public services. title: Trump Threatens To Halt Aid To Nigeria Amid Christian Killing Claims | 10 News
description: US President Donald Trump has threated to halt all aid to Nigeria and possibly "go into that now-disgraced country, guns a-blazing," if the nation did not stop the killing of Christians.  The comments come after Trump put Nigeria back on a list of countries that the US says have violated religious freedom last week.  Meanwhile, Nigeria's government rejected its designation by the US as a "country of particular concern’’ over alleged religious freedom violations, saying the move was based on misinformation and faulty data. title: Kentucky Plane Crash Death Toll Rises To 12 As Terrifying Footage Emerges | 10 News
description: The death toll from the fatal Kentucky plane crash has risen to at least 12, including a child.   And a warning we have some terrifying video that has just come into the newsroom the final moments of that fatal UPS flight as it hit a building and left an enormous fireball in its wake.  Investigators have now recovered the Blackbox and are focusing on an engine that fell from the left wing.  Our CBS colleague Tom Hanson is in Kentucky. title: Should Employees Work From Home? | 10 News+
description: Australians are working from home more and more, with up to two-thirds of employees working remotely each week in Melbourne, the nation's WFH capital.  However, not everyone is in love with the idea. Luxury Escapes CEO Adam Schwab told 10 News+ that working from home is a "failure on every front”. title: French Government Moves To Suspend Shein Over Sex Dolls As Paris Store Opens | 10 News
description: It wasn't the grand opening Shein was hoping for when they cut the ribbon on their first store in Paris.  Environmental protestors caused quite a scene at the front door and on the shop floor.  Meanwhile, the French government has moved to suspend the company's online store, after it was found to be selling childlike sex dolls.
